page.title: 08Penarth Town Council
page.content: Penarth is controlled by 3 councils, the Town Council, The Borough Council, and South Glamorgan Council. There are an estimated 21,000 people in Penarth. The Council is responsible for a number of things, the Kymin (a park by Penarth beach), The Paget Rooms (an entertainment hall),Penarth allotments and offices. There are 16 people on the Council from 4 parties, plus a Town Clerk, Mr. Vick, and the Mayor, Dr. Sibert. There has been some form of Council in Penarth for 91 years. Penarth Town Council began in 1974. At present the Council spends about Â£170,000 a year. In the future the Council would like to make Penarth a Tidier and prettier place to attract more tourists. Penarth has a twin town in Brittany called St. Pol. The most common problems are dogs and litter.
